intro: Guatteria bemban, commonly known as the Bemban guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Marcaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant features broad, glossy leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found growing in dense forests or along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
